data: Forms a lexical resource based on WordNet, providing sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word meanings (synsets).

Contains approximately 5,000 text snippets, extracted from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial text, linking artificial intelligence technology and the Semantic Web to better recognize, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Includes entity-sentiment annotation to address the challenge of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially differing sentiments. This human-annotated dataset, with over 10,700 news headlines, provides insight into sentiment variation dependent on specific entities in financial news.

A tokenized and annotated dataset from speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). This resource aims to understand the influence of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relationships in financial documents with approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relationship types across eight entity pairs (such as person-title, org-money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.

Compiled from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, providing researchers the opportunity to study how news headlines influence price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, helping to identify and classify financial companies in text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset with real financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with deep analysis of financial reports. Curated by financial experts, focusing on deep reasoning beyond financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial questions.
